wordpressPost.title: Water Saving Tips: How One Person Saved 144,000 Gallons of Water
wordpressPost.content:
Even if your water situation is crystal clear, chances are you know someone who is dealing with murky H2O issues. A new report from the World Resources Institute describes surging demand for water’global and local; today and long-term’which is driven by complex factors like population growth, droughts, and extreme precipitation events.

The good news is that people are acting and adapting. In southern California, for example, recent progress is quietly astonishing, according to multiple news reports. A big piece of this progress is attributable to new technology innovations that help easily and efficiently curb water consumption’e.g., chic new faucet designs, more water-efficient farming practices, and filling reservoirs with shade-balls to reduce evaporation.
At WeSpire, we work with large organizations intent on harnessing the power of their employees’ behavior to help on such difficult environmental and social problems.

Frequently, a super user emerges: a natural leader whose enthusiasm gives others the confidence and awareness to participate more themselves.

Say hello to Stefanie Schmidt.
Stefanie is the all-time leader in the WeSpire Home Water Savers project. As we post, she has saved 144,193 gallons of water. And counting. She says it’s easy, and she loves to share water saving tips with her friends, co-workers, and the guest who she meets on the job at MGM Resorts.
Stefanie works at MGM’s Dolphin Habitat at the Mirage in Las Vegas, Nevada. It’s dry in Vegas, with average rainfall less than half an inch per month. Unsurprisingly, MGM Resorts’ management works hard on water conservation, and it’s paying off: they’ve saved 94 million gallons of water in the past two years.

Water conservation holds a special place in my heart. I love the oceans and want to help protect our Earth’s resources. I like the My Green Advantage app’it’s an easy way to share. I absolutely love participating. It’s so great to make others aware that they can make a difference. Simple things like taking shorter showers or watering your lawn less can really add up.Stefanie Schmidt

What can you do to reduce water consumption, starting today?

We have 10 water saving tips for you, based on WeSpire user data. Each action is a relatively small change, that when done habitually, can make a big impact.

Fan Club: Most Popular Water-Saving Actions

Top 5 actions by number of times completed

  1. Turn off the faucet while brushing teeth
  2. Wait to run dishwasher until it’s full
  3. Wash a full load of laundry
  4. Take a shower that’s 5 minutes or less
  5. Wear clothes and use towels more than once before washing
  6. Super-Savers: Most Impactful Water-Saving Actions

Super-Savers: Most Impactful Water-Saving Actions

Top 5 actions by amount of water saved

  1. Install a gray-water system
  2. Install a rainwater harvesting system
  3. Report a leak in a faucet or toilet at work
  4. Upgrade a toilet that uses less than 1.6 gallons per flush
  5. Fix a leaky faucet or valve
